scenario_name: Nimbus AI Edge 3.0 – Global Enterprise Launch (90‑Day Workback)
company_context: Nimbus Cloud Solutions (NASDAQ: NCS) is a leading provider of AI‑powered edge computing platforms for enterprise IoT. The product is **Nimbus AI Edge 3.0**, the next‑generation hardware‑software appliance that enables real‑time inference on‑premise with a unified SaaS management layer. Market opportunity: $12B TAM in manufacturing, logistics, and smart‑city verticals, with a projected 15% CAGR. Competitive positioning: differentiated by on‑device privacy, sub‑10‑ms latency, and a plug‑and‑play AI marketplace, positioning Nimbus ahead of competitors such as NVIDIA EGX, HPE Edgeline, and Dell Edge Gateways. Launch date: **Monday, 15 Mar 2025**. Launch event: hybrid “Nimbus AI Edge 3.0 Global Reveal” streamed from the San Francisco HQ auditorium, with live demos, a keynote by CEO Maya Patel, and a press reception at the nearby Palace of Fine Arts. The launch will be supported by a 90‑day cross‑functional work‑back plan involving 16 core team members across Product, Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Legal, Finance, Partner, and Customer Success functions.
meeting_event_details:
Date: **Monday, 10 Jan 2025**
Time: **09:00 – 12:00 PST** (3‑hour duration)
Location: **Nimbus HQ – Boardroom A, 555 Market St, San Francisco, CA** (hybrid link provided for remote participants). Agenda: final review of release candidate, sign‑off on legal/compliance, confirmation of partner enablement kits, and approval of the launch day run‑of‑show.
stakeholders: Maya Patel – Chief Executive Officer (overall launch sponsor, final business approval)
Liam Chen – VP of Product Management (product vision, feature prioritization, beta program oversight)
Aisha Rahman – Director of Engineering – Edge Platform (lead of hardware & firmware, RC build schedule)
Diego Torres – QA Lead – Edge Systems (release candidate validation, test automation)
Priya Singh – UX Lead – Nimbus AI Console (user experience sign‑off, demo flows)
Olivia Martinez – Director of Marketing – Enterprise Solutions (Go‑to‑Market strategy, launch communications)
Ethan Brooks – Senior Product Marketing Manager (partner & analyst briefings, press kit)
Ravi Patel – Global Sales Enablement Manager (sales playbooks, quota planning)
Sofia Alvarez – Partner Enablement Lead (OEM & system integrator training, co‑sell agreements)
Natalie Kim – Senior Legal Counsel – Technology (IP, export controls, GDPR/CCPA compliance)
James O'Leary – Pricing & Finance Analyst (price modeling, discount structures, revenue forecasting)
Megan Liu – Compliance Officer – Data Security (SOC 2, ISO 27001, FedRAMP readiness)
Carlos Gutierrez – Customer Success Lead – Early Adopters (beta onboarding, success metrics)
Emily Wu – Beta Program Manager (beta recruitment, feedback loop, RC candidate selection)
Victor Huang – Cloud Infrastructure Lead (edge‑to‑cloud connectivity, capacity planning)
Tara Singh – Product Operations Manager (project schedule, risk register, resource allocation)
deliverables: Nimbus AI Edge 3.0 Release Candidate RC‑1 (hardware build + firmware + Nimbus AI Console v3.0) – signed off by 31 Jan 2025
Beta Program Report – aggregated feedback, defect backlog, and go/no‑go recommendation – due 14 Feb 2025
Launch Playbook – detailed day‑of‑event run‑sheet, media list, crisis communication plan – due 28 Feb 2025
Press Release & Media Kit – approved by Legal and Marketing – ready by 05 Mar 2025
Partner Enablement Kit – co‑sell collateral, technical integration guides, joint demo scripts – ready by 07 Mar 2025
Pricing & Discount Model Document – tiered enterprise pricing, volume discounts, subscription vs perpetual – approved by Finance by 04 Mar 2025
Compliance Sign‑off Package – GDPR, CCPA, Export Control, SOC 2 audit evidence – completed by 06 Mar 2025
Customer Training Curriculum – on‑site labs, recorded webinars, certification exam – live by launch day
Post‑Launch Monitoring Dashboard – real‑time telemetry on sales, adoption, system health, NPS – live 15 Mar 2025
Executive Summary Deck – launch results, KPI snapshot, next‑phase roadmap – delivered 30 days post‑launch
success_criteria: Achieve ≥ 100,000 paid enterprise subscriptions within 30 days of launch (target $12 M ARR)
Beta program Net Promoter Score (NPS) ≥ 70 and defect leakage ≤ 2% into RC‑1
Zero critical compliance findings; all audit sign‑offs obtained before launch
Secure at least 5 strategic OEM/SI partners with co‑sell agreements signed before launch
Earn coverage in top 5 technology media outlets (TechCrunch, Wired, The Verge, Bloomberg Technology, CNBC) with ≥ 10 M total impressions
Launch event attendance ≥ 2,000 live/virtual participants and ≥ 95% satisfaction rating in post‑event survey
Post‑launch system uptime ≥ 99.9% for edge devices during the first 60 days
Customer Success churn ≤ 2% in the first 90 days
constraints: Total launch budget capped at **$5 M** (including event, marketing spend, partner incentives, and contingency)
All hardware components must be sourced from approved Tier‑1 suppliers; any change requires a 2‑week lead time
Compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR) – must obtain export license for any component shipped to EU/Asia before 12 Mar 2025
Beta program must conclude by **14 Feb 2025** to allow a 4‑week RC stabilization window
Key external dependency: Cloud provider (Azure) scheduled maintenance window 20‑22 Mar 2025 – must not impact launch day telemetry
Limited availability of the San Francisco auditorium (must be booked by 31 Dec 2024)
Executive leadership requires weekly status updates and a formal go/no‑go checkpoint on **31 Jan 2025**
workback_prompt: Create a detailed 90‑day workback plan for the Nimbus AI Edge 3.0 major product launch at Nimbus Cloud Solutions. Include all phases (beta program, release candidate validation, legal/compliance sign‑off, pricing, partner enablement, marketing, launch event execution, post‑launch monitoring). Identify weekly milestones, owners (using the stakeholder list), required deliverables, risk mitigation steps, and dependencies. Align the plan with the constraints (budget $5M, compliance deadlines, hardware supplier lead times) and success criteria (100k subscriptions, NPS ≥ 70, media coverage, etc.). Provide a Gantt‑style timeline and a concise executive summary of critical path items.
